>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com

>

>and I em'd her asking if she had a sub for applesauce ... btw, thanks for
>sending the two *Z* recipes, I can wait to try these!!!
>
>hth ...
>Pris
>
>~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*
>
> > I use prune puree as a fat substitute, ususally used with chocolate
>brownies, cakes or with spice cakes,
> > food that already have a strong flavor where the prune taste gets lost.
>I love using pumpkin b/c it
> > doesn't add any taste but it adds kind of a yellowish color (not
>orange).
>applesauce works really well with
> > cakes and sweets, but not with bread and rolls. you may want to try
>using different applesauce like natural
> > or the unsweetened kinds, sometimes the sugar added to applesauce can
>change the flavor in the recipe...
>
>~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*
>

messages.subject: Re: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Holly ... below is part of my friend s e-m (shes a nutritionist/dietitian/something) and I em d her asking if she had a sub for applesauce ... btw, thanks
messages.messageBody:
Hi Holly ...

below is part of my friend's e-m (shes a nutritionist/dietitian/something)
and I em'd her asking if she had a sub for applesauce ... btw, thanks for
sending the two *Z* recipes, I can wait to try these!!!

hth ...
Pris

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

> I use prune puree as a fat substitute, ususally used with chocolate
brownies, cakes or with spice cakes,
> food that already have a strong flavor where the prune taste gets lost.
I love using pumpkin b/c it
> doesn't add any taste but it adds kind of a yellowish color (not orange).
applesauce works really well with
> cakes and sweets, but not with bread and rolls. you may want to try
using different applesauce like natural
> or the unsweetened kinds, sometimes the sugar added to applesauce can
change the flavor in the recipe...

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

messages.subject: RE: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: For everyone looking for Z recipies, I have one family one that I can share (which is good if you have a lot of maters too) and one I found in one of my
messages.messageBody:
For everyone looking for "Z" recipies, I have one family one that I can
share (which is good if you have a lot of "maters" too) and one I found in
one of my cookbooks tonight.....

This is my grandfathers Tomato,Zucchini Casserole

2-3 Large Tomatoes Thinly Sliced
2-3 Z's Thinly sliced
1-2 Large white onions thinly sliced
1 stick of butter (ok so I didn't say it was low fat but its GOOD)
parmesan cheese (kraft grated is fine)
garlic salt

Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a medium casserole dish (with a lid) begin one layer of tomatoes, then
a layer of Z's, then a layer of Onions, top with a generous pat of butter,
then sprinkle (generous again) parmesan and garlic salt over top. Do as
many layers as dish will hold as ingredients will shrink while cooking. On
the top layer use a LOT of parmesan and double the butter you used on the
other layers. TRUST ME THIS IS WONDERFUL. Its hubbys favorite food. Bake
for 45 min at 350 degrees.


Ok...the next recipie is from one of my favorite cookbooks.....

Zucchini Sticks

475 degrees. Serves 6

1/2 c + 1 tbsp bread crumbs
1/4 c parmesan
1 1/2 tsp fresh oregano, finely minced
3 Med Zucchini
Olive Oil Spray
Freshly ground black pepper

Preheat oven to 475 degrees. Combine bread crumbs, Parmesan and oregano on
a plate. Cut squash into evenly sized spears. Put them on baking sheet in
one layer, spray them with olive oil. Turn them all over and spray again.
Roll each in crumb mixture and back to oiled baking sheet. Bake 8-10 min.
till brown. Serve Hot.

Hope someone can use these!

Holly
>From: "Nanci and Thomas Kuykendall" <tn-k4of5@...>
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>To: unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>Subject: RE: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
>Date: Mon, 26 Jun 2000 11:36:40 -0700
>
>
>I do substitute
> >applesauce for oil when baking to cut the
> >Pris
>
>Is that an equal ratio to what the oil is? Can you use it in the place of
>butter or shortening as well for baking? I bake a lot, and have heard
>about the applesauce thing, but not tried it yet.
>
>Nanci K.
>

messages.subject: RE: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: I do substitute ... Is that an equal ratio to what the oil is?  Can you use it in the place of butter or shortening as well for baking?  I bake a lot, and have
messages.messageBody:
I do substitute
>applesauce for oil when baking to cut the
>Pris

Is that an equal ratio to what the oil is? Can you use it in the place of butter or shortening as well for baking? I bake a lot, and have heard about the applesauce thing, but not tried it yet.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: I hear *that* ... if something tastes DIETY, I d just prefer NOT partaking, thanks but no thanks; always taste like BARK to me :P
messages.messageBody:
I hear *that* ... if something tastes DIETY, I'd just prefer NOT partaking,
thanks but no thanks; always taste like BARK to me :P<

Pris

messages.msgSnippet: try baking with an egg substitute (like ener-g). this would cut fat even if you still used oil ... From: Holly Atchison  To:
messages.messageBody:
try baking with an egg substitute (like ener-g). this would cut fat even if
you still used oil

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: LOL  I don t hate applesauce but I just don t like the way things taste when I bake with it.  Im not so much worried about fat per se but Saturated Fat. Im not
messages.messageBody:
LOL I don't hate applesauce but I just don't like the way things taste when
I bake with it. Im not so much worried about fat per se but Saturated Fat.
Im not one of those people who doesn't eat anything with fat in it and
drinks diet drinks ect. I would just like the things I do eat to be as
healthy as possible while tasting good. Just wanted to make sure I didn't
sound to "Diet Train-ey" <grin>

Holly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: Prunes and they don t change the taste, believe it or not   You can buy the pureed prunes in most grocery stores.  You sub out 1/2 and 1/2 to start and see
messages.messageBody:
Prunes and they don't change the taste, believe it or not <g> You can buy
the pureed prunes in most grocery stores. You sub out 1/2 and 1/2 to start
and see how your recipes do.

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: well, I don t use OO to bake w/ just to cook w/ but I do substitute applesauce for oil when baking to cut the fat ... oops, I just read the part about not
messages.messageBody:
well, I don't use OO to bake w/ just to cook w/ but I do substitute
applesauce for oil when baking to cut the fat ... oops, I just read the part
about not liking applesauce, it's the only alternative I know to cut the
fat, sorry ... maybe someone else will have another suggestion ... I have a
good friend who is a nutritionist/diatetician/whatever her title is, I'll
ask her what she'd suggest using instead of applesauce :)

Pris

> Pris
>
> I saw that you "only use olive oil" does that really work on EVERYTHING
> like vegetable oil? I love Olive Oil but Im afraid to use it for baking
and
> such as im afraid that it will make sweets taste funny. Sweets as in
> Muffins ect. I hate canola and vegetable oil so im looking for a
healthier
> alternative to them other than applesauce.
>
> Holly
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] *Z* recipes :)
messages.msgSnippet: Pris I saw that you only use olive oil  does that really work on EVERYTHING like vegetable oil?  I love Olive Oil but Im afraid to use it for baking and such
messages.messageBody:
Pris

I saw that you "only use olive oil" does that really work on EVERYTHING
like vegetable oil? I love Olive Oil but Im afraid to use it for baking and
such as im afraid that it will make sweets taste funny. Sweets as in
Muffins ect. I hate canola and vegetable oil so im looking for a healthier
alternative to them other than applesauce.

Holly
